Class PEMReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • java.io.BufferedReader
        • org.bouncycastle.util.io.pem.PemReader
          • org.bouncycastle.openssl.PEMReader
            • nl.nikhef.jgridstart.passwordcache.PEMReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Readable

    public class PEMReader
extends PEMReader
    PEM file reader that works directory on files, integrated with PasswordCache.

    • Method Detail

      • readObject

        public static Object readObject(File in)
                         throws FileNotFoundException,
                                IOException
        Return single object from PEM file.

        The first object will be returned, others are discarded.

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        IOException

      • readObject

        public Object readObject()
                  throws IOException

        This method also invalidates the password when an IOException occurs and throws a PasswordCancelledException when the user cancelled the password entry.

        This method accepts garbage before and after any PEM blocks (outside of BEGIN/END). BouncyCastle 1.46 does not accept this (earlier versions do).

        Currently uses BufferedReader.mark(int) and BufferedReader.reset(), so these cannot be used by calling code, sorry.

        Overrides:
        readObject in class PEMReader
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readObject

        public static Object readObject(File in,
                Class<?> type)
                         throws FileNotFoundException,
                                IOException
        Return single object from PEM file.

        This version accepts a type as argument. The first object that matches the type is returned, others are discarded.

        Returns:
        The object read, or null if type not found.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        IOException

      • readObject
